text:
Raskolnikov's Fury

Nighttime street; Raskolnikov fuming, fists clenched.  
“Hey! You Svidrigaïlov! What do you want here?”  
“What do you mean?” the gentleman scowls.  
“Get away, that’s what I mean.”  

---  

Raskolnikov charges, rage boiling over.  
“How dare you, you low fellow!”  
He raises his cane, but a constable intervenes.  
“Enough! No fighting in public!”  

---  

Raskolnikov, desperate, grabs the constable's arm.  
“I’m a student, Raskolnikov! Help me!”  
“Look here, she’s hopelessly drunk!”  
“Who knows what happened to her?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov confronts a gentleman in anger while trying to protect a drunken girl he believes has been mistreated.
